page.title: 15Ecology
page.content: Public footpaths do not attract many walkers, but one useful right of way(as often, with no actual path) is from the Common south-east to Templeton. The map shows various footpaths on the Common itself, though dog-walkers and others walk there freely, a boon to townsfolk. Hungerford seems to avoid extremes of weather and is often clear of the snow seen lying on the downs to the south. In recent years there has been a general tendency to avoid the harsher sprays on the land, and this area is not noticeably troubled with pollution. The presence of many lichens testify to the purity of the atmosphere. There is no nature reserve in the area and wildlife is normally found in the hedgerows,trees fields and pastures nearby.
